SUMMARY: A New York City clean-air program allows citizens to report idling commercial vehicles in exchange for a cut of the fines. Some drivers respond with fists.

TITLE: St. Peter’s Defeats Kentucky in Basketball
SUMMARY: The small Jesuit university in Jersey City is in high spirits after eliminating Kentucky, a basketball blue blood, from the N.C.A.A. men’s tournament.

TITLE: NCAA Tournament: What to Watch as Second Round Begins
SUMMARY: The round of 32 begins on Saturday, and some first-round underdogs are back on the court.

TITLE: Women’s March Madness: What to Watch on Day 2
SUMMARY: If you’re looking for underdogs to root for, plenty of teams playing on Saturday are looking for their first taste of tournament glory.

TITLE: When Your Second Home Is the First One You Buy
SUMMARY: Some hopeful homeowners are keeping their rentals in pricey, urban areas, but are buying second homes in more affordable, rural and suburban locations.

TITLE: The Art of Making Thai Noodles, Far From Thailand
SUMMARY: Cooks in the nation’s diaspora offer wisdom on making pad Thai and other classics at home. First tip: Sometimes taste is more important than tradition.

TITLE: Bill Gross Ruled the Bond World for Years. Then He Was Deposed.
SUMMARY: In “The Bond King,” Mary Childs traces the rise and fall of the superstar fund manager.

TITLE: Spring Returns
SUMMARY: Some suggestions for how to spend the first week of the season.

TITLE: Running Stars Are Racing in New York City, and It’s Not the Marathon
SUMMARY: The New York City Half Marathon is scheduled to be run on Sunday for the first time in three years, and a number of prominent names will be at the starting line.

TITLE: ‘They Keep Killing Us’: Violence Rages in Sudan’s Darfur Two Decades On
SUMMARY: The resurgence of ethnically motivated attacks in the country’s restive western region has led to enormous displacement and a growing humanitarian crisis.

TITLE: After Stumbles, Biden’s Health Secretary Seeks a Reboot
SUMMARY: A lawyer by training, Xavier Becerra helped pass the Affordable Care Act as a congressman, but he is not steeped in infectious disease. His tenure will be defined by how he handles the fallout from Covid-19.

TITLE: Rabbi Chaim Kanievsky, Venerated Talmudic Scholar, Dies at 94
SUMMARY: He initially insisted, “Canceling Torah study is more dangerous than the coronavirus.” But he had a change of heart, even before testing positive.

TITLE: Michael Bublé Always Finds a Way
SUMMARY: Hustle, charm and a remarkable ability to slot himself into songs have made the musician a star — even though his style has never aligned with pop trends.

TITLE: Campbell Addy Up Close
SUMMARY: The photographer of the moment on what it takes to be seen.

TITLE: Billy Eppler’s Recipe for Mets Success: Piching, Depht, Thick Skin
SUMMARY: Billy Eppler was an executive with the Yankees, signed Shohei Ohtani to the Angels and was (briefly) a player agent. He would rather talk about the Mets’ future.

TITLE: Camille Norment Explores New Sonic Terrains at Dia Chelsea
SUMMARY: The composer and sculptor, born in America and based in Norway, presents two installations on the border of art and music.

TITLE: The Museum Ships and Submarines That Are National Landmarks
SUMMARY: According to the National Park Service, some 120 vessels in the United States are designated as national historic landmarks.
